==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|こ|なべ}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=こなべ|小|tr1=ko|t1=small|鍋|tr2=nabe|t2=pot, pan}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|こなべ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|こなべ}}

# a small [[pot]]
# a small [[pan]]

====Usage notes====
The term {{m|ja|鍋|tr=nabe}} refers to either a {{m|en|pot}} (that tends to be taller and deeper) or a {{m|en|pan}} (that tends to be shallower and broader). See the {{m|ja|鍋}} entry for more details.

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|小鍋立て|こなべだて}}: simple one-pot cooking

====Idioms====
* {{ja-r|小鍋は直に熱くなる|こなべ は じき に あつく なる}}: “a small pot gets hot quickly” → smaller things tend to reach their limits more quickly
